H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5360.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong and so find relief from their anger

H3313.def: = process by which a light bearing object gives out or reflects a bright light

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1576.def: = action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward

H1343.def: = state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans

2.gl: to lift up oneself = to come into action

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5042.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which water flows in a rapid and plentiful stream

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

2.gl: (to cause) to bubble up > to pour out

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H1616.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H7523.def: = causative action by which humans take the life of other humans, whether or not intentionally

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3050.def: = short form of {L:יהוה<SDBH:יהוה>}, only found in poetic texts

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H3050.def: = short form of {L:יהוה<SDBH:יהוה>}, only found in poetic texts

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H3320.def: = action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H3884.def: = marker indicating that if the event in focus would not have been true another event would not haven taken place

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H1745.def: = location characterized by the absence of any sound or noise; ≈ a metaphor for the realm of death

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8312.def: = process by which the mind of humans is filled with distressing thoughts

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H1942.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H2266.def: = state in which two or more inanimate objects are joined together

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

4.gl: to make an alliance with someone else

H1413.def: = causative action by which humans inflict wounds on their body with a knife, ► as a sign of mourning, or in order to reinforce one's prayer

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4869.def: = a high and therefore unattainable location, either because of its natural environment or as a result of human construction efforts, ≈ associated with security and protection from the enemy

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H4268.def: = location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6789.def: = process by which liquids disappear from existence, as a result of warm weather

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
